00022 #include <FdoStd.h>
00023 #include "Flags.h"
00024 
00025 /// \brief
00026 /// FdoXmlSerializable provides the ability to serialize an FDO object 
00027 /// to an XML Document. Serialization support can be added to any class by basing
00028 /// it on FdoXmlSerializable and implementing the _writeXml callback.
00029 class FdoXmlSerializable 
00030 {
00031 public:
00032 
00033     /// \brief
00034     /// Writes this object to a file. A complete XML document,
00035     /// containing this object, is written.
00036     /// 
00037     /// \param fileName 
00038     /// Input the file name.
00039     /// \param flags 
00040     /// Input controls the writing of the elements to the document.
00041     /// If NULL then the default flags are used (see FdoXmlFlags::Create())
00042     /// 
00043     FDO_API virtual void WriteXml(
00044         GisString* fileName, 
00045         FdoXmlFlags* flags = NULL
00046     );
00047 
00048     /// \brief
00049     /// Writes to an XML writer. This object is appended to the XML document
00050     /// being written. Unlike the other WriteXml() functions it is not necessarily 
00051     /// the only object in its document.
00052     /// 
00053     /// \param xmlWriter 
00054     /// Input the XML writer. When this function completes, the
00055     /// XML writer's current position will be just after this object.
00056     /// \param flags 
00057     /// Input controls the writing of the elements to the writer.
00058     /// If NULL then the default flags are used (see FdoXmlFlags::Create())
00059     /// 
00060     FDO_API virtual void WriteXml(
00061         GisXmlWriter* xmlWriter, 
00062         FdoXmlFlags* flags = NULL
00063     );
00064 
00065     /// \brief
00066     /// Writes to a text writer. A complete XML document,
00067     /// containing this object, is written.
00068     /// 
00069     /// \param textWriter 
00070     /// Input the text writer.When this function completes, the
00071     /// text writer's current position will be just after this object.
00072     /// \param flags 
00073     /// Input controls the writing of the elements to the writer.
00074     /// If NULL then the default flags are used (see FdoXmlFlags::Create())
00075     /// 
00076     FDO_API virtual void WriteXml(
00077         GisIoTextWriter* textWriter, 
00078         FdoXmlFlags* flags = NULL
00079     );
00080 
00081     /// \brief
00082     /// Writes to a stream. A complete XML document,
00083     /// containing this object, is written.
00084     /// 
00085     /// \param stream 
00086     /// Input the stream. When this function completes, the
00087     /// stream's current position will be just after this object.
00088     /// \param flags 
00089     /// Input controls the writing of the elements to the stream.
00090     /// If NULL then the default flags are used (see FdoXmlFlags::Create())
00091     /// 
00092     FDO_API virtual void WriteXml(
00093         GisIoStream* stream, 
00094         FdoXmlFlags* flags = NULL
00095     );
00096 
00097     /// \brief
00098     /// Gets the stylesheet for converting the XML document from 
00099     /// internal to external format. When classes derived from FdoXmlSerializable
00100     /// define an internal format, they must override this function to return a
00101     /// stylesheet that does the conversion.
00102     /// 
00103     /// \return
00104     /// Returns NULL by default (no internal format defined)
00105     /// 
00106     FDO_API virtual GisXmlReader* GetFromInternalStylesheet();
00107 
00108 protected:
00109     /// \brief
00110     /// Callback for writing to XML. Derived classes must implement this function
00111     /// to serialize the class into XML element(s). The class must be written as one 
00112     /// XML element (with 0 or more sub-elements).
00113     /// 
00114     /// \param xmlWriter 
00115     /// Input serialize to this XML writer. GisXmlWriter provides
00116     /// functions for writing elements and attributes.
00117     /// \param flags 
00118     /// Input the XML flags that were passed to FdoXmlSerializable::WriteXml()
00119     /// 
00120     FDO_API virtual void _writeXml(
00121         GisXmlWriter* xmlWriter, 
00122         const FdoXmlFlags* flags
00123     ) = 0;
00124 
00125 };
00126 
00127 #endif
00128
